reference: Volume Two, Issue Nineteen, Phile #1 of 8
title: Phrack Inc. Index
historical_context: This issue of Phrack was released during the summer of 1992, a time when the hacker community was actively engaging in various forms of digital exploration and experimentation.
target_audience: Hackers, Phrackers, and enthusiasts of hacker culture.
short_summary: This article serves as the index for Phrack Issue Nineteen, providing a brief overview of the contents and encouraging community participation.
summary: The index outlines the various articles included in this issue, ranging from technical discussions on DCL utilities for VMS hackers to social security number formatting. The mention of SummerCon highlights the importance of community gatherings in hacker culture, where individuals can share knowledge and network with peers. Overall, this article sets the stage for the rest of the issue, fostering a sense of community and collaboration among hackers and phreakers.
